page.title: 07ROADS AND FOOTPATHS
page.content: In the area we surveyed,all the roads were category B or C.The road which passed the Boars Head was the busiest in fifteen minutes 8 cars 2 vans 2 bicycles and 2 pedestrians passed by. This shows it was fairly busy.The roads generally were in a bad condition with potholes and weeds growing.There were no verges or footpaths alongside and the roads were narrow.There were 2 carparks near the open country so people could enjoy the views and the wildlife.Across one of the roads was an aquaduct carrying the macclesfiled canal.The tunnel was 3.2m high and 31m long.There were many footpaths leading to the countryside, crossing through farmland and parkland most paths were marked.Some following private roads to farms and Lyme Park.
